body_html:
Just tried on tf-1.4/cuda8/windows10 and it is working as expected.
But yes, the logs from @e-ka show that the tensorflow process (pid 8040) has the device 0,2,3 open where it should have only seen 1 device. Kind of odd since tensorflow is reporting only 1 device.
The driver on my box is a little older 388.19 (vrs 390.65) and I have windows10 instead of windows7.
I can update my box to the latest driver to rule that out.

body:
Just tried on tf-1.4/cuda8/windows10 and it is working as expected. 
But yes, the logs from @e-ka  show that the tensorflow process (pid 8040) has the device 0,2,3 open where it should have only seen 1 device. Kind of odd since tensorflow is reporting only 1 device.
The driver on my box is a little older 388.19 (vrs 390.65) and I have windows10 instead of windows7.
I can update my box to the latest driver to rule that out.
